snippet: Researchers have sequenced the complete genome of the so-called Tyrolean Iceman, and discovered that he had brown eyes and brown hair, was lactose intolerant and had Type O blood.
abstract: Report in journal Nature Communications details new information resulting from the complete genetic sequencing of the Tyrolean Iceman, nicknamed Otzi, an early human who was preserved by ice in the Italian Alps until his discovery in 1991; researchers find that Otzi had brown eyes and brown hair, was lactose intolerant and had Type O blood.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have sequenced the complete genome of the so-called Tyrolean Iceman, and discovered that he had brown eyes and brown hair, was lactose intolerant and had Type O blood.

headline.print_headline: Lactose Intolerant, Before Milk Was on Menu
headline.seo: ‘Iceman’ Had Brown Eyes and Hair, and Was Lactose Intolerant
headline.main: Lactose Intolerant, Before Milk Was on Menu
